Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of two added white bands at bottom of sherd; exterior: dot pattern at rim above dot and billet pattern frieze between bands; reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (noted in Gardner's plate)
Curator's comments: The number '5' is written in pencil on the exterior surface. The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.828. Type B kantharoi typically have a painted inscription beneath the rim. They do not however, have rim patterns. The rim pattern on this sherd is consistent with some Simple Animal Style chalices.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 63, no. 744, pl. XXI, no. 744)
Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 197)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 680, no. 395)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1098) (phase 2)
